author: mostaan Saremi
text: 'The food is great and the owner is very friendly.'

author: Hidenori Kasahara
text: '(Translated by Google) Very nice staff
column5: comfortable climate
column6: tasty sushi and ramen
column7:
all good deal. BYOB style.
There is a calm feeling like coming to a Japanese shop.

(Original)
Very nice staff

author: Jessica Nguyen
text: 'Our favorite go to sushi spot in Hoboken'

author: Alyssa Marie
text: 'I am not sure why there are a decent amount of positive reviews‚Ä¶ I always make sure to check ratings however this has got to be the worst sushi I have had in HB. Very disappointed. Everything down to the spicy mayo did not taste well. Super pricy for the quality as well.'

author: Thomas J. Lee
text: "Great little sushi restaurant run by a nice Korean owner.  Sushi deluxe goes for 17.50 and regular is 15.50. In Hoboken
column5: that's quite reasonable.  I would visit again."

author: Allison Kucera
text: 'Best sushi in Hoboken
column5: I order from here every week. Also the owner is so nice'

author: Tatiana Nogueira
text: 'Wonderful sushi! Perfect service by Jay. We used to live in JC and would go to there at least once a week. If you order from UBU just order "Hobokenaki" It is so perfect
column5: I dream about it everyday!! Perfect ‚ù£Ô∏èü•∞'

author: Melanie Tam
text: "Typical Hoboken fushi but will somewhat satisfy the sushi craving if you are in a pinch. I ordered for pickup on a Monday evening and I got there a little early but didn't have to wait too long until my order was ready. I just had the Fivestar roll (tuna
column5: salmon
column6: yellow tail
column10: cucumber and spicy sweet sauce). It wasn't bad but it was a little bit too saucy for me. I think if I order again
column11: I would probably just stick to the regular rolls

author: followJTusa JT USA
text: '(Hoboken.jan. 2021). Japanese and Korean cuisine: For starters
column5: I had bowl of Seafood Soup of delicately cooked mussells
column6: baby squid
column7: and kelp. The quantity  served in a petite bowl was just right for an appetizer. I enjoyed sharing the Lobster roll on the "Specials" board also as appetizer. The Five Star roll that combines Tuna
column9: salmon with two other sashimi-quality fishes is a nine-piece large roll - done inside-out and topped with two house-blended sauces. (I would have preferred a sprinkling of sesame seeds or Tobiko along with the sauces. But it was very satisfying nevertheless). I also shared a combination 3-roll Maki which
column11: were not at all the large
column12: \nrice-laden offering one expects but rather delicately prepared thinner rolls so typically Japanese in approach. (Thank you for helping me stick to my carb-restraint diet :-) ) All tasted fresh with no fish aftertaste. Ubu has continuously been in business for 23 years in this locationand kept its loyal clients. Expect an  Authentically Asian atmosphere
column13: that also features Korean favorite. Nice and intimate when not busy; safely partitioned dining sections. Call for update on table availability for a large group.'

author: Jitin Verma
text: 'Ubu is amazing in terms of comfort. Run by two amazing gentlemen
column5: warm and welcoming
column6: they make sure to service exceptionally every time. The food is amazing and my favorite is their teriyaki bowls and age tofu.'

author: Adam Fink
text: 'Tiny sushi that isnt very good. Much better options in area.'

author: Jeannie Mark
text: 'Drove all the way to Hoboken to pick up food from this little hole in the wall and was not disappointed. Not only was the food delicious but it was also packed so nicely and ready so fast! Definitely going to come back again. The spider roll was amazing. And the chicken ubu bowl was so generous in portion and very good as well.'

author: Alan Hom
text: 'Always great service and food.'

author: Levi Cooke
text: "Outstanding scene for quality japanese food. Got there near six
column5: it wasn't packed at all. I will be back with my coworkers. This place has a cool design. I can see why they have a lot of great reviews."

author: Jocelyn A-G
text: 'At first
column5: my stupidity put the review in the question section. Although I would love to say here that I genuinely love this place. Staff is so welcoming and sweet plus the food was amazing. I was also satisfied with the prices. I am definitely going back there.'

author: Damon G
text: 'A fav place for tasty japanese food. food was so delish. had a sister come into town and asked me to take her here again. this place has a cool feel to it.'

author: Mounika Reddy
text: 'Amazing ramen!!!'

author: Xauen Zirpolo
text: "Ordered delivery on a Friday night. Food took nearly 2.5 hours to arrive from a place only a few blocks away. I understand the spike in demand lately
column5: so normally that'd be excusable. However
column6: the sushi I ordered was absolutely bottom-tier in quality; the fish tasted old
column8: and the overall flavor was poor. The ramen was the same case
column9: with barely any pork in it and totally lacking flavor. Prices aren't terrible
column10: but still higher than other spots in Hoboken that serve better sushi more reliably so I can't even credit it that. I'd try your luck at a different place
column11: there's no dearth of Japanese or Korean in Hoboken."

author: Elaine Ramos
text: 'Tomomi sushi is located in downtown Alhambra. I came here to celebrate my birthday with my family. They were able to accommodate 15 of us and we had a nice private area looking out the window. Overall experience was pleasant. Our server was very nice and food was very good with large portion. I will be back here again soon.'

author: Robert Williams
text: 'Excellent spot to eat some food when in a hurry. The service is speedy
column5: prices are convenient
column6: fantastic character. Will visit here again'

author: Ian
text: 'This is my favorite sushi place in Hoboken. Really good sushi. The fish tasted really fresh. Not overpriced. The owner is really nice. Definitely a good place to share a meal or a drink with a date or friends or family. It has a cozy hole in the wall ambience.'

author: Warren Ng
text:
'Worth all my 5 stars!

Super nice service. Cute shop. Fantastic food.

Spicy tofu soup is banging üëåüèº.

Owner gave us dessert and some sushi on the house ‚ò∫Ô∏è'

author: Alex B
text: 'The place to go for ramen and sushi! Very friendly staff. Very quiet place where you can have a nice conversation with your partner. And the best part? Bring your own bottle!'

author: Alyssa Allen
text: 'My favorite sushi restaurant in Hoboken! I go almost every week. The owner is so sweet! Sushi is great and good prices. Also
column5: they have the best miso soup!'

author: Aram Jafarey
text: 'I really like this place. Been twice now. The food is well prepared
column5: fresh and nicely presented. The staff is attentive and courteous. Relatively compact space. If you are in Hoboken looking at sushi places
column6: I would recommend this one. BYOB and they are happy to accommodate bottle opening

author: Kareem K
text: 'The place offers an awesome range of delicious food. I love eating here. Employees are always friendly
column5: pricing is fair and the place is always kept clean.'

author: John M
text: 'I celebrated my PhD last night in this excellent restaurant. Well we had a marvelous evening and the venue was definitely the reason for that outstanding event. The team  helped in a lovely manner
column5: the meals were great and my friends were so  joyful. We shall no dout return for more joyful events. thanks very much.'

author: Suthida Chuenklin
text: "I'm not a tofu person but Ubu's spicy tofu soup is my new favorite! Also love their tofu sushi as a complimentary."

author: Sebastian Coe
text: "Nice cozy little restaurant. It's easy to miss since it's not on one of the main thoroughfares."

author: Ernest Paul Januario
text: 'Awesome old style Japanese restaurant.'

author: Kimberly Guiao
text: 'Great Japanese restaurant!  The ramen was amazing!  Friendly staff and awesome service.'

author: Kanstantsin Chernik
text: 'Very nice place. Stuff is kind and friendly. Food is delicious. Prices are reasonable. Some compliments on house.'

author: Julio
text: 'This my first time coming to this restaurant and the food was Amazing but the waiter was demanding tips ! Very rude of him ! I don‚Äôt believe that you should be force to give a tip.'

author: Collin Tennant
text: 'Very good service here. Nice place to just relax and enjoy your relaxation.'

author: Sajedeh Saremi
text: 'Awesome food with great prices'

author: daniela u
text: 'Terrible would not recommend it. The individual in charge is rude and needs to not have the restaurant on seamless or grubhub. Countless times he was rude. If you order from this establishment please be warned.'

author: Bhhk
text: 'Cute place. Food are excellent'

author: Tina Nustin
text: "One of the best sushi spot in the bay area ! Service food vibe... I just love everything about this place. Servers are very very attentive and knowledgeable
column5: and dishes are always on point! Presented beautifully too I recommend to ask the chefs about their daily specials
column6: cuz it changes so often! Just give this place a shot and you won't regret it."

author: Dimas Martadarma
text: "Luckily came across this spot when wandering off the main street
column5: and was not disappointed! We odered the Kani salad
column6: the high five roll
column7: and rock and roll ‚Äî all of which was delicious. The best part was our server who was helpful and attentive throughout our meal. Can't wait to come back"

author: Sydney Ng
text: "First time visiting Hoboken/Washington Street this weekend. Was overwhelmed by all the loud bars and restaurants - it was only 3pm! Couldn't figure out where to eat but luckily came across this restaurant off the beaten path on a quieter street.\n\nNo frills
column5: very homey
column6: local place. Had seaweed salad and two special rolls. The friendly older man serving us also provided a complimentary app and ice cream. Such a nice touch!! Definitely not amazing sushi or food
column7: but I'm glad we spent our money here."

author: YiZhi Lee
text: 'Horrible restaurant. In an empty restaurant at 1:45pm
column5: the owner refused to serve us once he saw we had 2 strollers and 4 kids(2 at 4 and 2 infants). Absolutely horrible customer service.'

author: Shengxi Wu
text: "I came here only because of the overall high rating. The restaurant is quiet and nice
column5: but the food is not impressive. I ordered a crab donburi at the restaurant
column6: which costs $10.5 instead of $9.00 mentioned by Google. The food itself is just okay
column8: JUST GENERIC. The taste is average or maybe below average (I am big fan of Japanese food and I've tried something better and cheaper before
column9: maybe here is more expensive due to the restaurant's location). The avacado in it does not taste so fresh and I don't think it worth the money. Will not come back again for the donburi.\nPlus I also asked the staff for Wifi access and he told me there is no wifi in the restaurant. Not sure if that is the case."

author: Ireviewthings Sometimes
text: 'One of the worst tempora I have had of all places.'

author: Star
text: "Nasty food.  Ordered  couple dishes to go. Their beef bowl with veggie only had 2 spoons disgusting ground beef and 2 spoons of tasteless rise in the bottom
column5: and rest was full of shredded lettuce as veggie. Couldn't eat it'  Sushi was disgusting
column6: and I never had seaweed salad like that. Waste of money
column7: and bad experience. I would not recommend this place."

author: Nha Ha
text: 'Great cozy Japanese spot! Friendly owner and chef.'

author: Matthew Platt
text: 'Solid sushi
column5: the ice cream dessert they give you at the end was a nice touch.'

author: Emmy B
text: 'This was such a cute little Japanese restaurant! We ordered the chicken rice bowl and pork ramen and it was so good!! Good place to stop and get lunch before riding a bus/train to NYC!'

author: P Wong
text: 'Been here several times for eat-in
column5: take-out
column6: and delivery. For me
column7: the experience has been quite consistent so maybe the management shifted / learned from previous reviews. Anyway
column8: the sushi is good quality and I absolutely love the homey atmosphere. I‚Äôve actually never had anything but sushi here
column9: so can‚Äôt speak to the other dishes. Also
column10: this is not a high end fancy place
column11: you can meander over to Illuzion for that. Come to Ubu if you want something more down to earth. BYOB!\n2/9/2019 Edit - still one of the best restaurants in Hoboken! I just had their soon doo boo (spicy tofu soup) and it was so delicious that I had to edit my old review to let everyone know the soon doo boo is awesome!!!'

author: Dyanne I
text: 'Always prompt and the food delicious.'

author: Rochelle Vargas
text: "Such an amazing find! This mom and pop shop
column5: is hands down one of the best Korean restaurants I've been to. I would go every day if I could :) food is super quick and comes out amazing. I love their spicy soup
column6: pan fried meat dumplings
column7: and their big ol' steam Ubu. 4 Stars all the way."

author: Evelyn T.
text: 'The food
column5: location & service is great!'

author: ÎòêÎßàÏä§
text: 'Service was the best and food was good!'

author: J. B.
text: 'I walked past so many times and decided to stop in alone while waiting for a friend. It‚Äôs so quaint and cozy and the staff is attentive. It was a slow weeknight and they provided a starter piece of sushi on the house and chocolate ice cream at the end. Their tea was delicious too! Highly recommend. Oh it‚Äôs also BYOB but there is a minimum $18 per person. Still BYOB! Definitely coming back with a few friends next time.'

author: John McMullen
text: "Ordered online and when I went to pick up the order he said he didn't receive it. Walked out of store to check on my phone and I received a text saying my order was cancelled. Shady"

author: Yuriy Rusko
text: "This is the best sushi place in Hoboken
column5: hands down. The kind of staff that will keep you coming back just to say hello. I've been coming for years and hopefully will keep coming for years to come."

author: David
text: 'Friendly owner
column5: love the donburi veggie bowls. Quick for lunch and to-go.'

author: Alek Corradini
text: "I have been a regular at ubu for a while now
column5: and I can say that all of their food is incredible. The staff is friendly
column6: informative
column7: and very helpful when it comes to finding the right dish for you. I have never had a bad experience there and I'm always happy to go
column8: especially for a nice bowl of ramen on a cold day."

author: pouria babvey
text: 'If you are Ramen-lover like me try it at Ubu. Highly recommended. You could also enjoy free ice cream at the end.'

author: Rachel Weir
text: 'Amazing family place!! I always come here when I am in town and enjoy every single moment! Best sushi in town; all the other places are so disappointing compared to Ubu'

author: Jaffrey H (jhede1)
text: 'Great place
column5: friendly waiter and free ice cream!'

author: Ben Peterson
text: 'Amazing tasting food and they always had something on the table to enjoy from soup
column5: salad
column6: rice and then the meal. I was also given complimentary ice cream which was the cherry on top. I was from out of town and wish i could come here everyday'

author: JohnnyGi
text: 'Great tast
column5: cozy place
column6: exellent  price'

author: Kendra B
text: 'Delicious bowl! Good service.'

author: Amy Aguilar
text: 'My husband and I love this place! The food is delicious and the service is extremely friendly!'

author: Sam Lavery
text: 'Best sushi in the Boken! Teriyaki chicken was on point as well üëåüèª'

author: Bullet mage Gaming
text: 'Great service!  And location is nice!'

author: Radima Alakaeva
text: 'I love this place. the owner of the place so kind. and sushi is delicious ü§ó'

author: Corinna Zennig
text: "Friendly staff and cozy atmosphere. Unfortunately
column5: the rice bowl I had (Oyakudon
column6: $11) had zero Japanese flavor. It was overly salted with normal salt and not soy sauce and was pretty much just a normal Western scrambled egg with scrambled chicken on rice. Can't say anything about the sushi."

author: hsiu-chen Chung
text: 'Very yummy. Good Service!'

author: Angelo Sotocruz
text: 'Very attentive staff. The food was delicious
column5: and came put in a timely manner at the right temperature. I had the chicken ramen
column6: steamed dumplings
column7: and Miso. I also had a couple of free sweats as well. Very professional staff
column8: and I would recommend this restaurant to my friends.'

author: Carlos Calderon
text: 'I have been eating at Ubu for over 10 years and the quality has been outstanding since day one. Be sure to try the special "Oh My Roll" and the spicy crunchy spider.'

author: Ekaterina Skulskaia
text: 'Very tasty home like food
column5: nice people. I will  definitely be back.'

author: Abhishek Roy Chowdhury
text: 'Me and my wife love this place. Food is awesome. Definitely one of the best Japanese food places in town. The behavior of the staffs are very nice all the time. They always welcome everyone with smile and professionalism. Price is also reasonable.'

author: Iraida Valentin
text: 'Freshest
column5: tastiest sushi! This little in the wall has excellent service and food!'

author: Nickitas Georgas
text: 'A gem. Unique. Home style Japanese cooking. I have never been in Japan
column5: but I was transplanted there by this experience. First time? Get a bowl!'

author: mario zhang
text: "the chirashi is a must try! It's so good!"

author: Peter Chu
text: 'Our go to place for sushi in Hoboken'

author: Steven Hoffenson
text: 'Excellent good and lunch specials
column5: though the service can be very slow'

author: Frank Gonzalez
text: 'Great service
column5: food is very good and the owner takes the time to shake your hand and thank you for coming in.'

author: Nandi Zhang
text: 'This is a place where your experience depends highly on what you order. I like the quiet and cozy atmosphere. Sushi is good in general. We received two small dishes on the house. But tempura is a fail. The flour/bread crumbs are thicker than the shrimp itself.'

author: Hou Sean
text: 'Best udon best chicken bowl everrrrrrrrrrrrrrr!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The udon is chewy to the degree that is just right and the texture of chicken suits the rice perfectly! Best Japanese restaurant in us so far.'

author: Sudharsana Viswanathan
text:
'(Translated by Google) Nice tiriyaki

(Original)
Nice tiriyaki'

author: Frank Lombardo
text: 'Excellent food and extremely friendly service in a cozy atmosphere! My go to sushi restaurant.'

author: Tommy Castner
text: 'Absolutely great! The lobster bowl was loaded with meat
column5: the management gave us a free appetizer and a free mini dessert. Super friendly place
column6: affordable

author: Gabby P
text: 'The rice bowls are huge and delicious
column5: 100% recommend this place'

author: Paul Caeruleus
text: 'Little gem of Hoboken'

author: AJ
text: 'Really disappointed. Ordered a bunch of sushi for delivery. The order came quickly but that was all That was positive. First off
column5: the order was incorrect. 2 of the rolls were wrong. They give you a microscopic amount of ginger and wasabi with cheap soy sauce packets. Ordered a side of spicy mayo. Again
column6: super small amount. The Kano salad was mostly lettuce. Definitely not worth the money. Illuzion blows this place away.'

author: ChrisNZ
text: "The high ratings seem unjustified. Came out of my way to go here due to the reviews. Good service thank you but small portion size
column5: limited ingredients
column6: and poor food presentation. Not good value I'm afraid."

author: Jason Farrugia
text: 'Friendly service
column5: excellent food
column6: and a comfy atmosphere.'

author: Alex Perez
text: 'Best sushi!'

author: Zezhou Li
text: 'This is a great place to have Korean and Japanese food. Lunch special Teriyaki is very tasty!'

author: Christopher Kuras
text: 'Food is always amazing. Host is extremely cordial
column5: and will remember you after a few visits. He will also sometimes give you free samples of menu items and yogurt drinks.'

author: shalea walker
text: 'Delicious Food!'

author: Zihao Yang
text: 'Pretty good!!!!!'

author: John ippolito
text: 'Highly recommend the lobster salad and the California rolls'

author: Sazzu Hope
text: "My favorite place. Have been going there for years and years and it never disappoints. I usually get the ubu rice bowl and they are to die for. Literally sometimes even get 2 of them to eat at once. IDK what they put in there exactly
column5: but it's healthy and I always feel amazing afterwards. Totally recommend this place. The owners are friendly and know me by name
column6: and always make me feel welcome and taken care of."

author: Kyle Lukas
text: 'The food is pretty good
column5: although the gyoza was slightly overcooked. The service is spot on  and quick but that could be due to only a few tables being filled on a friday night. Traditional japanese restaurant and prices are cheap.'

author: Sang Lee
text: 'Nice service
column5: below average food'

author: Yang Charles
text: 'Ramen is good.'

author: Denis Ovchinnikov
text: 'Great food
column5: nice atmosphere
column6: very friendly owners.'

author: Paul A1970
text: "Supermarket quality. I have NO idea how anyone can give this more than 3 stars. It's a Saturday
column5: and only two of us are here!"

author: Luca Bessi
text: "it can't be more Japanese. Good food
column5: not only sushi."

author: Luis Mendoza
text: 'One of my favorite sushi spots.  Jay the owner/chef makes the biggest rolls.  Nice relaxing ambient perfect for a date or a small gathering with friends.'
